claim: Ajax is widely regarded as having one of the most iconic superhero costumes of the 21st century.
extra_info: Ajax refers to superhero_name = 'Ajax'; superpowers refers to power_name;
reasoning: The claim is subjective ('widely regarded as having one of the most iconic superhero costumes') and expresses a qualitative value judgment that cannot be objectively verified from data. Additionally, the database contains no information about costumes or costume design — it only tracks physical attributes, powers, alignment, publisher, etc. This is both a SUBJECTIVE and OUT-OF-SCHEMA case.

content.text:
I need to analyze this claim carefully before querying the database.

The claim states: "Ajax is widely regarded as having one of the most iconic superhero costumes of the 21st century."

This is a subjective/opinion-based claim - "widely regarded as having one of the most iconic superhero costumes" is a qualitative value judgment that cannot be verified from a database. Let me still check the database to see if there's any costume-related data.

input.description: List all tables in superhero database

content.content:
alignment       colour          hero_attribute  publisher       superhero     
attribute       gender          hero_power      race            superpower

tool_use_result.stdout:
alignment       colour          hero_attribute  publisher       superhero     
attribute       gender          hero_power      race            superpower

content.content:
CREATE TABLE superhero
(
    id             INTEGER not null
            primary key,
    superhero_name TEXT default NULL,
    full_name      TEXT default NULL,
    gender_id      INTEGER          default NULL,
    eye_colour_id  INTEGER          default NULL,
    hair_colour_id INTEGER          default NULL,
    skin_colour_id INTEGER          default NULL,
    race_id        INTEGER          default NULL,
    publisher_id   INTEGER          default NULL,
    alignment_id   INTEGER          default NULL,
    height_cm      INTEGER          default NULL,
    weight_kg      INTEGER          default NULL,
    foreign key (alignment_id) references alignment(id),
    foreign key (eye_colour_id) references colour(id),
    foreign key (gender_id) references gender(id),
    foreign key (hair_colour_id) references colour(id),
    foreign key (publisher_id) references publisher(id),
    foreign key (race_id) references race(id),
    foreign key (skin_colour_id) references colour(id)
);

tool_use_result.stdout:
CREATE TABLE superhero
(
    id             INTEGER not null
            primary key,
    superhero_name TEXT default NULL,
    full_name      TEXT default NULL,
    gender_id      INTEGER          default NULL,
    eye_colour_id  INTEGER          default NULL,
    hair_colour_id INTEGER          default NULL,
    skin_colour_id INTEGER          default NULL,
    race_id        INTEGER          default NULL,
    publisher_id   INTEGER          default NULL,
    alignment_id   INTEGER          default NULL,
    height_cm      INTEGER          default NULL,
    weight_kg      INTEGER          default NULL,
    foreign key (alignment_id) references alignment(id),
    foreign key (eye_colour_id) references colour(id),
    foreign key (gender_id) references gender(id),
    foreign key (hair_colour_id) references colour(id),
    foreign key (publisher_id) references publisher(id),
    foreign key (race_id) references race(id),
    foreign key (skin_colour_id) references colour(id)
);

content.text:
The database schema confirms my initial assessment. The database contains information about superheroes including their physical attributes (eye color, hair color, skin color, height, weight), alignment, gender, race, publisher, and superpowers. 

There is **no data** about costumes, costume design, costume rankings, public opinion, or any concept of "iconic" status. The claim makes a **subjective** value judgment ("widely regarded as having one of the most iconic superhero costumes") that cannot be objectively verified from any database, and furthermore the database doesn't even contain costume-related information (**out-of-schema**).
